newsitem.title: LESOTHO: Chinese embassy refuses translator in Lesotho trial.
newsitem.headline: Chinese embassy refuses translator in Lesotho trial.

text.p: A Lesotho High Court judge said on Thursday he was appalled by the refusal of the the Chinese embassy in Maseru to provide a translator in the triple murder trial of a Chinese businessman.
He said the government of China had also refused to pay the legal fees of the accused.
Shao-Ming Sheng, 38, has pleaded not guilty to murdering his father, mother and son on the outskirts of the Lesotho capital Maseru on August 6, 1994.
"I am told the Chinese government chose not to pay the legal fees of the accused as they were entitled to do so according to Lesotho laws and procedures.

"But what I am most displeased about is that the Chinese government has refused to provide us with an interpreter. I regard it as an unfriendly act which frustrates the ends of justice in Lesotho," said Judge Churchill Maqutu.
